Diagnosis: Males of
P. billeni
are characterized by the very short and globular palp with simple appendages; the RTA is small, curved, and slightly indented at the tip. Females are recognized by the epigyne with a circular depression in the oval posterior lip of the epigyne.
Etymology: The species name is a patronym in honour of Johan Billen, a renowned ant specialist.
Description: Male ( holotype , MRAC 217477). Total l 4.25.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 45. Scanning electron micrography pictures of warts.
Crinopseudoa billeni
sp. nov.
, male paratype (MRAC 217478) (A, B),
Crinopseudoa bong
sp. nov.
, male paratype (MRAC 218174) (C, D),
Crinopseudoa catharinae
sp. nov.
, male paratype (MRAC 217423) (E, F), and
Crinopseudoa flomoi
sp. nov.
, female paratype (MRAC 217438) (G, H). A, C, E, G, warts in front of fovea; B, D, F, detail of previous; H, detail of carapace wart. Arrows indicate excretory pore.

Figure 46. Scanning electron micrography pictures.
Crinopseudoa caligula
sp. nov.
, female paratype (A) and male paratype (B, L) (both MRAC 216812),
Crinopseudoa otus
sp. nov.
, male paratype (C, F, G–I) (MRAC 216775),
Crinopseudoa flomoi
sp. nov.
, male paratype (D, K) (MRAC 217460) and female paratype (E) (MRAC 217438), and
Crinopseudoa
e
phialtes sp. nov.
, male paratype (MRAC 218197) (J). A, wart in front of fovea; B, retrolateral trichobothrium on male palpal tibia; C, dorsal bothria at base of tarsus; D, seta on wart in front of fovea; E, preening brush on leg III; F, tarsal organ on leg II; G, chelicerae, frontal view; H, detail of previous; I, modified setae, detail of previous; J, left palpal tibia, retrolateral view; K, right palpal tibia, retrolateral view; L, retrolateral tibial apophysis, dorsal view.

Figure 47.
Crinopseudoa bong
sp. nov.
, female paratype (MRAC 216949) (A–C) and male paratype (MRAC 218174) (D–F). A, anterior lateral spinnerets (ALS); B, posterior median spinnerets (PMS); C, posterior lateral spinnerets (PLS); D, ALS; E, PMS; F, PLS. ac, aciniform gland spigot(s); cyl, cylindrical gland spigot(s); mAp, minor ampullate gland spigot(s); MAp, major ampullate gland spigot(s); p, piriform gland spigot(s); t, tartipore.

Figure 48.
Crinopseudoa billeni
sp. nov.
, male holotype MRAC 217477) (A, B) and female paratype (MRAC 218114) (C–E). A, B, right male palp, retrolateral and ventral views; C, D, epigyne, ventral and posterior views; E, cleared epigyne, dorsal view. Scale bars = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Carapace as in male, l: 2.03; w: 1.70. Sternum smooth, l: 1.05; w: 1.10. Abdomen greyish brown, without do scutum. Legs orange-brown, not warted.

Epigyne ( Figs 48C–E , 59A ): dark area with fairly large central pit in posterior half, provided with an oval lip; copulatory openings near posterior margin; strongly curved copulatory ducts leading forward, then backward into roughly triangular, widely separated spermathecae.
